definition[0]: to explain to people in authority why you did something wrong or why something happened, and be punished if necessary
example[0]: Their coach must answer for the team’s poor performance.
definition[1]: to be responsible for causing a lot of trouble
definition[2]: used to say that you cannot make a decision for someone who is not there, or give their opinion
example[1]: I’m sure John will help us – I can’t really answer for the others.
